snippet: With Senator Bernie Sanders still in the race, the president said the stakes were too high to let divisions stand in the way of defeating Donald J. Trump.
abstract: Pres Obama formally endorses Hillary Clinton for president as he attempts to unite Democratic Party after divisive primary campaign; also meets with Sen Bernie Sanders at White House, urging him to rally his millions of supporters behind Clinton; Sanders says he plans to meet soon with Clinton to discuss ways to defeat Donald J Trump in general election.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Alan Rappeport, Nick Corasaniti and Yamiche Alcindor contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With Senator Bernie Sanders still in the race, the president said the stakes were too high to let divisions stand in the way of defeating Donald J. Trump.

headline.main: Obama Endorses Hillary Clinton, and Urges Democrats to Unite
headline.print_headline: Moving to Unite the Party, Obama Endorses Clinton
